pageProps.contentHtml:
Lp spaces

Let f∈L1(R,dx)f \in L^1\p{\R, \diff{x}}f∈L1(R,dx) and β∈(0,1)\beta \in \p{0, 1}β∈(0,1). Prove that

∫R∣f(x)∣∣x−a∣β<∞\int_\R \frac{\abs{f\p{x}}}{\abs{x - a}^\beta} < \infty∫R​∣x−a∣β∣f(x)∣​<∞

for (Lebesgue) a.e. a∈Ra \in \Ra∈R.
Solution.

It suffices to show that

∫−RR∫R∣f(x)∣∣x−a∣β dx da<∞\int_{-R}^R \int_\R \frac{\abs{f\p{x}}}{\abs{x - a}^\beta} \,\diff{x} \,\diff{a} < \infty∫−RR​∫R​∣x−a∣β∣f(x)∣​dxda<∞

for every R>0R > 0R>0. By Fubini-Tonelli (everything is non-negative),

∫−RR∫R∣f(x)∣∣x−a∣β dx da=∫R∣f(x)∣∫−RR1∣x−a∣β da dx=∫R∣f(x)∣∫x−Rx+R1∣a∣β da dx.\begin{aligned} \int_{-R}^R \int_\R \frac{\abs{f\p{x}}}{\abs{x - a}^\beta} \,\diff{x} \,\diff{a} &= \int_\R \abs{f\p{x}} \int_{-R}^R \frac{1}{\abs{x - a}^\beta} \,\diff{a} \,\diff{x} \\ &= \int_\R \abs{f\p{x}} \int_{x-R}^{x+R} \frac{1}{\abs{a}^\beta} \,\diff{a} \,\diff{x}. \end{aligned}∫−RR​∫R​∣x−a∣β∣f(x)∣​dxda​=∫R​∣f(x)∣∫−RR​∣x−a∣β1​dadx=∫R​∣f(x)∣∫x−Rx+R​∣a∣β1​dadx.​

From here, there are three cases: If x+R<0x + R < 0x+R<0, then

∫x−Rx+R1∣a∣β da≤∫−R01∣a∣β da≤∫−RR1∣a∣β da.\int_{x-R}^{x+R} \frac{1}{\abs{a}^\beta} \,\diff{a} \leq \int_{-R}^0 \frac{1}{\abs{a}^\beta} \,\diff{a} \leq \int_{-R}^R \frac{1}{\abs{a}^\beta} \,\diff{a}.∫x−Rx+R​∣a∣β1​da≤∫−R0​∣a∣β1​da≤∫−RR​∣a∣β1​da.

Similarly, if x−R>0x - R > 0x−R>0, then

∫x−Rx+R1∣a∣β da≤∫0R1∣a∣β da≤∫−RR1∣a∣β da.\int_{x-R}^{x+R} \frac{1}{\abs{a}^\beta} \,\diff{a} \leq \int_0^R \frac{1}{\abs{a}^\beta} \,\diff{a} \leq \int_{-R}^R \frac{1}{\abs{a}^\beta} \,\diff{a}.∫x−Rx+R​∣a∣β1​da≤∫0R​∣a∣β1​da≤∫−RR​∣a∣β1​da.

Finally, if x−R≤0≤x+Rx - R \leq 0 \leq x + Rx−R≤0≤x+R, then x≤Rx \leq Rx≤R, so [x−R,x+R]⊆[−2R,2R]\br{x - R, x + R} \subseteq \br{-2R, 2R}[x−R,x+R]⊆[−2R,2R], which means

∫x−Rx+R1∣x∣β dx≤∫−2R2R1∣x∣β dx.\int_{x-R}^{x+R} \frac{1}{\abs{x}^\beta} \,\diff{x} \leq \int_{-2R}^{2R} \frac{1}{\abs{x}^\beta} \,\diff{x}.∫x−Rx+R​∣x∣β1​dx≤∫−2R2R​∣x∣β1​dx.

Hence, in every case,

∫x−Rx+R1∣x∣β dx≤∫−2R2R1∣x∣β dx=2∫02R1∣x∣β dx=2(2R)1−β1−β<∞.\int_{x-R}^{x+R} \frac{1}{\abs{x}^\beta} \,\diff{x} \leq \int_{-2R}^{2R} \frac{1}{\abs{x}^\beta} \,\diff{x} = 2\int_0^{2R} \frac{1}{\abs{x}^\beta} \,\diff{x} = \frac{2\p{2R}^{1-\beta}}{1 - \beta} < \infty.∫x−Rx+R​∣x∣β1​dx≤∫−2R2R​∣x∣β1​dx=2∫02R​∣x∣β1​dx=1−β2(2R)1−β​<∞.

Hence,

∫−RR∫R∣f(x)∣∣x−a∣β dx da≤∫R∣f(x)∣∫x−Rx+R1∣a∣β da dx≤2(2R)1−β1−β∥f∥L1<∞,\int_{-R}^R \int_\R \frac{\abs{f\p{x}}}{\abs{x - a}^\beta} \,\diff{x} \,\diff{a} \leq \int_\R \abs{f\p{x}} \int_{x-R}^{x+R} \frac{1}{\abs{a}^\beta} \,\diff{a} \,\diff{x} \leq \frac{2\p{2R}^{1-\beta}}{1 - \beta} \norm{f}_{L^1} < \infty,∫−RR​∫R​∣x−a∣β∣f(x)∣​dxda≤∫R​∣f(x)∣∫x−Rx+R​∣a∣β1​dadx≤1−β2(2R)1−β​∥f∥L1​<∞,

which completes the proof.
